required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Stopping Postpartum Vitamin A Supplementation: Missing Concealed Benefit
clinical_study.official_title: Stopping Postpartum Vitamin A Supplementation: Are we Missing Concealed Benefit?

lead_sponsor.agency: International Centre for Diarrhoeal Disease Research, Bangladesh

clinical_study.source: International Centre for Diarrhoeal Disease Research, Bangladesh

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of post-partum maternal vitamin A supplementation on breast milk bioactive compounds and immune status, growth and morbidity of children in the first four months of life.

detailed_description.textblock: The effect will be assessed by the milk and blood.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Prevention

primary_outcome.description: At three time points- < 3-day postpartum (before supplementation) 7 wk postpartum (1wk after 2nd dose of supplementation) 15 wk postpartum
At three time points- < 3-day postpartum (before supplementation) 7 wk postpartum (1wk after 2nd dose of supplementation) 15 wk postpartum

secondary_outcome.measure: Infant T helper cell immune responses
secondary_outcome.description: PHA stimulated whole blood IL-10, IL-13, IFN-gamma and IL-17 responses at two time points- 7 wk of age (1wk after 2nd dose of maternal supplementation , as well as, 1wk after first doses of pentavalent vaccination) 15 wk of age (1wk after three doses of pentavalent vaccination)

Tall like receptor (TLR)-4 and TLR9 agonist stimulated whole blood TNF-alpha and IL-10 and IFN-alpha responses at two time points- 7 wk of age (1wk after 2nd dose of maternal supplementation , as well as, 1wk after first doses of pentavalent vaccination) 15 wk of age (1wk after three doses of pentavalent vaccination)

other_outcome.description: Infant plasma vitamin A status at 7 wk and 15 wk of age
Infant Weight-for-Age z-score (WAZ) at 7 wk and 15 wk of age
Infant morbidity status up to four months of age

arm_group.description: Single dose 200,000 IU vitamin A supplementation at <3-day and placebo supplementation at 6-wk postpartum.
Placebo supplementation at <3-day and single dose 200,000 IU vitamin A supplementation at 6-wk postpartum.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Early & late postpartum vitamin A suppl
arm_group.description: 200,000 IU vitamin A supplementation, both at <3-day and 6-wk postpartum
Placebo supplementation, both at <3-day and 6-wk postpartum.

intervention.description: Single dose 200,000 IU vitamin A supplementation at <3-day and placebo supplementation at 6-wk postpartum.
Placebo supplementation at <3-day and single dose 200,000 IU vitamin A supplementation at 6-wk postpartum.
200,000 IU vitamin A supplementation, both at <3-day and 6-wk postpartum
intervention.arm_group_label: Early & late postpartum vitamin A suppl

intervention.description: Placebo supplementation, both at <3-day and 6-wk postpartum.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women >-18 years of age with low-risk obstetric
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women expecting a multiple birth
- Take vitamin A supplements during postpartum apart from study intervention
- Premature birth
- Newborn babies with birth defects and / or other serious diseases

overall_official.affiliation: International Centre for Diarrhoeal Disease Research, Bangladesh

facility.name: International Centre for Diarrhoeal Disease Research, Bangladesh
